findings.title: Owner privileges (In the period when the owner is not renounced)
findings.description: Admin has excessive privileges to manage various aspects of the contract, including voting, rewards, resource management, and configuration changes.
findings.contract: Multiple Contracts (including ProxyContract, StakingContract, DAOContract, FundsManager, Token)

findings.title: Token: WL address can change isLiquid
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to change the isLiquid status of a whitelisted (WL) address.

findings.title: Token: WL address can change NRGContract
findings.description: WL address has the privilege to change NRGContract, which may lead to unauthorized modifications.

findings.title: Admin can vote
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to vote.

findings.title: Admin can withdraw voting rewards to the contract
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to withdraw voting rewards directly to the contract.

findings.title: Admin can unfreeze a specific amount of resource for a user
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to unfreeze a specific amount of resource for a particular user.

findings.title: Admin Can Change Critical Contract Addresses
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to change the addresses of critical contracts such as ProxyContract, StakingContract, and DAOContract.

findings.title: Admin can change the allowance for compounding
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to modify the allowance for compounding, which could lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Admin Privilege to Modify Allow, Admin, and DAO Lists
findings.description: The admin has unrestricted access to add or remove addresses from the allow, admin, and DAO lists, potentially leading to unauthorized modifications.

findings.title: Admin can toggle the user fail-safe enabled status
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to enable or disable the user fail-safe feature.

findings.title: Admin Can Call unfreezeToContract()
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to call the unfreezeToContract() function, which may lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Admin can manage funds
findings.description: The admin has the capability to manage funds, which may lead to unauthorized fund manipulation.

findings.title: Admin Privileges: Unrestricted Function Calls
findings.description: The admin has unrestricted access to call sensitive functions unStakeTP(), addToTeamBufferAndFreeze(), freezeClaimVotingRewards(), and unstakeTeamBuffer() without proper validation or restrictions.

findings.title: Admin can add funds to teamBufferTotal
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to add funds to teamBufferTotal without any restrictions.

findings.title: Admin can withdraw team buffer
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to withdraw the team buffer, which may lead to unauthorized fund transfers.

findings.title: Admin can add/remove approved contracts
findings.description: The admin has the privilege to add or remove approved contracts, which could lead to potential security risks if not properly managed.

findings.title: Admin can set contracts necessary parameters and addresses
findings.description: The admin has excessive privileges to modify critical contract parameters and addresses.

findings.title: Admin, DAO and AllowList addresses can change energyPrice
findings.description: The Admin, DAO, and AllowList addresses have the capability to modify the energy price, which could lead to potential security risks.

findings.title: Unrestricted Access to Critical Contract Variables
findings.description: Admin, DAO, and AllowList addresses have unrestricted access to switch critical contract variables such as stopNRG, stopBuy, and removeNRGOverride values.

findings.title: Unstake Period Modification by Admin, DAO, and AllowList Addresses
findings.description: Admin, DAO, and AllowList addresses have the privilege to change unstakePeriod, which may lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Admin, DAO and AllowList addresses can change regenerationPeriodMultiplier
findings.description: The Admin, DAO, and AllowList addresses have the privilege to modify the regenerationPeriodMultiplier, which could lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Admin, DAO and AllowList addresses can change maxDays
findings.description: The Admin, DAO, and AllowList addresses have the privilege to modify the maxDays variable, which could lead to unintended consequences.
